subKeywords.title: Register as a Member
subKeywords.answer: To register as a member, click the 'Tilla Health Members' and click the first 'Register as a member' button on the top header and fill out the required details based on your plan.

subKeywords.title: Register as a Provider
subKeywords.answer: To register as a provider, click the 'Tilla Health Providers' and click the first 'Register as a Provider' button, fill out the required details, and submit the form for verification.

subKeywords.title: Register as a Broker
subKeywords.answer: To register as a broker, click the 'Tilla Health Brokers' and click the 'Register as a Broker' button, complete the registration form, and provide the necessary documentation for approval.

subKeywords.title: Register an Organization
subKeywords.answer: To register an organization, click the 'Tilla Health Members' and click the first 'Register as a member' button, choose your organization type and enter the organization details, and submit the required documents for review.

subKeywords.title: Verify Email Address
subKeywords.answer: To verify your email address, add your working email and click on the 'Email Verification' button. Then you will receive an email from us containing an OTP, and fill the OTP to verify your email.

subKeywords.title: Verify Email with OTP
subKeywords.answer: To verify your email address, add your working email and click on the 'Email Verification' button. Then you will receive an email from us containing an OTP, and fill the OTP to verify your email.

subKeywords.title: System Issue
subKeywords.answer: If you're experiencing issues with the system, please try refreshing the page, clearing your browser cache, or contact support if the issue persists.

subKeywords.title: Plan Pricing
subKeywords.answer: Here is the plan pricing list. Click this link to download.

subKeywords.title: Plan Details
subKeywords.answer: Here is a breakdown of the plans and their features:

subKeywords.title: Basic Plan
subKeywords.answer: The Basic Plan includes routine check-ups, vaccinations, and preventive care. It provides limited access to specialists and partial coverage for hospital stays, but it does not cover chronic disease management, maternity care, mental health services, or telehealth.

subKeywords.title: Standard Plan
subKeywords.answer: The Standard Plan offers all Basic Plan services, plus access to general practitioners and specialists for common conditions. It covers planned hospitalizations, basic chronic disease management, partial maternity care, basic counseling services, telemedicine, and care coordination.

subKeywords.title: Comprehensive Plan
subKeywords.answer: The Comprehensive Plan includes all Standard Plan services, access to a wide range of specialists, full coverage for hospitalizations, comprehensive chronic disease management, full maternity care, advanced mental health services, and full telemedicine access.

subKeywords.title: Family Plan
subKeywords.answer: The Family Plan covers comprehensive care for all family members, including pediatric and elderly care. It provides full access to specialists, comprehensive hospital coverage, chronic disease management, maternity and newborn care, mental health services, and telehealth.

subKeywords.title: Primary Care
subKeywords.answer: Primary care in all plans includes routine check-ups, vaccinations, and preventive care. Comprehensive and Family Plans extend these services to additional diagnostics and specific family member needs.

subKeywords.title: Specialty Care
subKeywords.answer: Access to specialists varies: Basic Plan offers limited access, Standard Plan includes common condition specialists, and Comprehensive and Family Plans provide full access to a wide range of specialties.

subKeywords.title: Emergency Care
subKeywords.answer: Emergency and urgent care coverage increases with each plan, from emergency-only visits in the Basic Plan to full coverage, including ambulance services, in Comprehensive and Family Plans.

subKeywords.title: Hospitalization
subKeywords.answer: Hospitalization coverage ranges from partial coverage in the Basic Plan to full coverage for planned and emergency hospitalizations in the Comprehensive and Family Plans.

subKeywords.title: Chronic Disease Management
subKeywords.answer: Chronic disease management is not included in the Basic Plan but is covered for common conditions in the Standard Plan and comprehensively in the Comprehensive and Family Plans.

subKeywords.title: Maternity and Newborn Care
subKeywords.answer: Maternity and newborn care is not covered in the Basic Plan but is partially covered in the Standard Plan. Full coverage is provided in the Comprehensive and Family Plans.

subKeywords.title: Mental Health Services
subKeywords.answer: Mental health services are not included in the Basic Plan, but basic counseling is provided in the Standard Plan. Comprehensive therapy and psychiatric care are available in the Comprehensive and Family Plans.

subKeywords.title: Telehealth Services
subKeywords.answer: Telehealth services are not included in the Basic Plan. The Standard Plan includes general telemedicine consultations, while the Comprehensive and Family Plans provide full telemedicine access for general and specialty care.

subKeywords.title: International Health Plans
subKeywords.answer: The International Health Plans offer flexible healthcare coverage for individuals seeking personal healthcare solutions. They include options for primary care, specialized treatment, mental health support, and chronic disease management.

subKeywords.title: International Care
subKeywords.answer: Additional coverage is available in the Standard Plan and above, including care coordination, second opinion services, and international care in the Family Plan.

subKeywords.title: International Health Plan
subKeywords.answer: The International Health Plan provides flexible healthcare coverage for individuals seeking personal healthcare solutions. It includes options for primary care, specialized treatment, mental health support, and chronic disease management.

subKeywords.title: Eligibility and Age Limits
subKeywords.answer: Eligibility for the plan includes main members and dependents from birth (for term babies of 38 weeks) up to 64 years of age.

subKeywords.title: Global Network
subKeywords.answer: Key features include access to a vast network of hospitals and expert physicians across 183 countries, including Africa, India, the Middle East, Europe, Asia, and South America.

subKeywords.title: Diaspora Health Connect
subKeywords.answer: Diaspora Health Connect is a dedicated healthcare plan for Ethiopian diaspora members who wish to support their families back home. It offers full coverage for children, spouses, and elderly parents, with access to preventive care, chronic disease management, and telemedicine services.

subKeywords.title: Eligibility and Maternity Benefits
subKeywords.answer: Eligibility includes main members and dependents from birth (for term babies of 38 weeks) up to 64 years of age. The plan also includes maternity benefits, last expense coverage, no health check-up requirements for enrollment, and minimal waiting periods for benefits.

subKeywords.title: Family and Health Services Abroad
subKeywords.answer: Key features of the plan include being designed for the Ethiopian diaspora community, seamless coverage for family health needs, and easy access to health services while abroad or in Ethiopia.

subKeywords.title: Individual Health Plan
subKeywords.answer: The Individual Health Plan offers flexible healthcare coverage for individuals seeking personal healthcare solutions. It includes options for primary care, specialized treatment, mental health support, and chronic disease management.

subKeywords.title: Eligibility and Member Criteria
subKeywords.answer: Eligibility is for members aged 18 to 60 years. For existing members, eligibility can be extended up to 65 years.

subKeywords.title: Coverage Features
subKeywords.answer: Key features include annual check-ups to promote preventive health, comprehensive inpatient and outpatient coverage, immunizations and pediatric visits for dependents, and 24/7 telemedicine consultations for immediate access to care.

subKeywords.title: Family Health Plan
subKeywords.answer: The Family Health Plan provides comprehensive health coverage for families, including children, spouses, and elderly parents. It offers options for preventive care, maternity services, pediatric and geriatric care, as well as chronic disease management.

subKeywords.title: Eligibility and Family Members
subKeywords.answer: Main members and dependents are eligible from birth (for term babies of 38 weeks) up to 64 years of age.

subKeywords.title: Family Health Needs
subKeywords.answer: Key features include comprehensive annual check-ups for the entire family, inpatient and outpatient services tailored to family health needs, pediatric care and immunizations for dependents, and 24/7 telemedicine consultations to address family health concerns anytime.
